AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raymond McMillon: defendant, appellant, and passenger in a tractor-trailer with undocumented aliens, convicted of alien transportation offenses, traveled with co-defendant to Laredo, questioned by Agent Pena at an immigration checkpoint, filed a motion to dismiss the indictment on speedy trial grounds, sentenced to 41 months' imprisonment, argues about the lawfulness of Agent Pena's immigration questions, claimed to have a possessory interest in the tractor-trailer due to a commercial purpose, appealed the district court's factual findings, had his speedy trial clock begin on July 8, 2014, and filed multiple motions to continue, including a motion to suppress and a motion for discovery of canine records, filed a motion to dismiss the indictment, defendant whose ability to adequately prepare for the case would have been affected if continuances were not granted
